individual_metadata.synopsis: Minthara, now freed from the influence of the Absolute and from a jail cell at Moonrise Towers, joins the players' party at their Camp. She is shaken from her experiences, and is coming to terms with the fact that she now understands the truth about the Absolute - that it is not a god at all, but something monstrous that lies within Moonrise.She wishes to join with the party, knowing they can help her get vengeance against the cult, and knowing that they are her only hope of salvation, thanks to the Prism that they hold, which shuts out the Absolute's voice.

27.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
27.text: I am ready to join you in battle, if you have space in your ranks.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I don't have room for you at the moment.

21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
21.text: Then make room. None among your allies can compare to me.

4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
4.text: Excellent. Let us teach the cult to fear us.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Perhaps later. You should rest for now.

39.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
39.text: It does not compare with the comforts of home, but your camp is almost palatial in comparison to my previous accommodation.

37.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
37.text: Thank you. For allowing me to come here, and for bringing me back to myself.

64.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
64.text: Each memory that returns to me is more disturbing than the last. The things that I did in the name of the Absolute... the things that were done to me.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Someone in this cult might have broken mine, too. We are going to break them back.

93.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
93.text: While our tadpoles live, and the cult have the means to control them, we will never be safe.

62.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
62.text: We must eradicate them, starting with General Thorm... I mean Ketheric. My deference to him is a habit that will die hard, I fear.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Any suggestions on how we kill an invulnerable man?

98.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
98.text: All that live can die. I can help you plot Ketheric's demise, but I need something from you first.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: You'll join me in this battle, then?

91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
91.text: Not only this battle, but all that come after.

42.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
42.text: It is the safest place to be.

70.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
70.text: Swear that you will keep me close... until the Absolute is dead, at least.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You're a victim of the cult. Of course I'll protect you.

79.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
79.text: The Prism will protect me. You will fight alongside me, and help me to get my vengeance.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Of course. You'll be a valuable ally.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Very well. You can join me.

19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
19.text: I knew you were different to other True Souls when we lay together. Now I know it was the Prism that silenced the Absolute in those moments, not you.

2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
2.text: But it was not the Prism that held me, and touched my mind and body. That was you.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You belonged to the Absolute then. I don't even know who you really are.

28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
28.text: When we lay together, I was myself for the first time since they butchered my mind.

3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
3.text: Kind words do not always come easily to me...

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *Her entire being joins with you for a moment, and you see all that she is. Dangerous, cunning, wounded, brutal, paranoid... and utterly loyal to those she trusts.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *And you have earned that trust, along with a small measure of her affection. It is a rare thing, well-hidden in the cold fortress of her mind, and it is precious.*

36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
36.text: Together we can have our vengeance on those who infected us.

81.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
81.text: Rest well, and keep your wits about you. Tomorrow, we go to war with the cult of the Absolute.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Tell me what you know about Ketheric's power first.

43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
43.text: General Thorm would have the world believe that his invulnerability is a gift from the Absolute.

85.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
85.text: That is a lie, intended to impress those who flock to the cult's cause, and to strike fear in the minds of those who stand against the Absolute.

78.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
78.text: I believe Thorm draws his power not from a divine source, but an arcane one.

59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
59.text: I suspect it is the very relic that Balthazar has been sent to retrieve.

25.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
25.text: We must find the necromancer, and claim what he seeks. Or destroy it.

76.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
76.text: Now, rest. We will need our strength for what lies ahead.

13.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
13.text: Moonrise is a den of necromancy, and the most powerful practitioner of the art is Thorm's closest advisor, Balthazar.

63.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
63.text: He has chambers beside the General's, on the upper floor of the tower. I suspect we will find answers there.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I'll be watching you - don't cause any trouble.

1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
1.text: I intend to cause plenty, but only for our enemies.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Sleep well. We will venture forth together come morning.

51.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
51.text: I do not sleep unless I wish to. Until I feel safe among this company, I shall spend my nights planning for the fights to come.

68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
68.text: I do not require sleep, but I shall use the solitude of the night to plan for the fights to come.

89.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
89.text: I would gladly join you in the fight. Leave one of your other allies here, and I shall.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Now that you're free, we can spend more nights together.

75.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
75.text: For now, we will travel together, and fight together. In time, perhaps we will lie together again.

56.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
56.text: It does not need to be. But if you prefer to focus on the fight, I will not distract you.

14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
14.text: I knew you were different to other True Souls when we met, but I could see nothing clearly.

26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
26.text: Now, thanks to the Prism, the Absolute does not cloud my thoughts at all. I see that together, we can have our vengeance on those who infected us.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Stay with me - you'll be a valuable ally.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Why are you so keen to join with me?

47.speaker: Player
47.text: There is no 'we'. I rescued you, but now you're on your own.

0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
0.text: Then you should have killed me rather than saving me.

29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
29.text: If I leave your side, the Prism will no longer protect me, and I will cease to be Minthara. The Absolute will make me its puppet again.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Fine. You can stay here, but I'll be watching you.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I don't trust you enough to feel safe around you.

54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
54.text: I am no threat to you - I am at your mercy.

30.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
30.text: We have the same goal, and you have a better chance of achieving it with me at your side.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I don't think so. You need to leave.

101.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
101.text: The next time we meet, I will kill you. In the Absolute's name, or my own.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Down in their flesh-hives, an Absolutist attacker slashed my mind. I know not who, but I know I seek revenge.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: And we will break them - it's time for revenge.

73.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
73.text: Strength will not save us from an enemy that can dominate our will.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I can help you fix it.

71.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
71.text: The best cure is vengeance, for both of us.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: If your mind is broken, you're no good to me.

38.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
38.text: Broken minds can heal just as well as broken bones.

77.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
77.text: I did not invite you to approach my tent. I need privacy while I recover from my ordeal at Moonrise.
